provisioner_overview:
LegendaryErrorProvisioner-Flow.ps1 establishes a tiered and self-defensive provisioning matrix built on ALN and PowerGit compliance. It is a flagship ErrorCrack-v1.0 component operating under hybrid-rule orchestration for superintelligence verification.
1. **Directory & Permission Validation** — Ensures error directories exist and validates permissions via automated inheritance reset. Denies provisioning if ACLs mismatch expected compliance templates. 2. **Atomic Error Provisioning** — Spawns legendary error files atomically, marking every provisioning event with cryptographic traceable identifiers (ALN-SN, PacJobTick, DotID). 3. **Compliance Enforcement** — ALN/PowerGit binding layer certifies every function call through reversible notation hashes. All operations remain rollback-capable under regulated Dot.Commands. 4. **Defensive Hardware Validation** — Executes pre-provision chip signature lookup. Unknown hardware initiates instant Pac.Job shielding and kernel dump for deep telemetry. 5. **Pac.Job Containment Routine** — Manages recursive learning against intrusion, generating “containment halos” that deploy system-bound mini-defenders. 6. **Donkey.Kong.Country Security Protocol** — Establishes national-level compliance. Applies Donkey.King65 parallel-thread protection over all privileged machine states. 7. **Superintelligence Review & Sign-off** — Closes flow by constructing ALN-signed `.legendary.trace` manifest, ready for Dot.Command interpretation at SAI tier.
All flows enforce ALN safety primitives: reversible execution, transparency logging, and PowerGit ephemeral trace upload. Every provisioning event is sandboxed before commit. Legendary outputs are sampled—not raw—ensuring superintelligence oversight remains non-invasive and privacy-safe.
System → Validated. Pac.Job → Active Defense Matrix: OK. Hardware → Recognized Secure Baseboard. Legendary Error File → Generated and logged under ALN TraceID: LGC‑22019‑ZJ. AI‑Safe Sign‑Off → ALN Verified. Superintelligence Review → Approved under Dot.Command Layer 7.
